text:
Crawford County (county code CR) is a county in Southeast Kansas. In 2010 census, 39,134 people lived there. Its county seat is Girard. Its biggest city is Pittsburg. The county was named after Samuel J. Crawford, Governor of Kansas.
It is in the Osage Cuestas and Cherokee Lowlands. It is halfway between Kansas City, Missouri and Tulsa, Oklahoma. Pittsburg State University is located in Crawford County.
Geography.
The U.S. Census Bureau says that the county has a total area of. Of that, is land and (0.9%) is water.
People.
The Pittsburg Micropolitan Statistical Area includes all of Crawford County.
